U.S. sale of new type of military equipment to S. Korea suggested
articles.content:
U.S. sale of new type of military equipment to S. Korea suggested 
    Pyongyang, March 22 (KCNA) -- An official of the U.S. Defense Department addressing the congress on march 18 hinted that it would sell about 1.2 billion U.S. dollars worth military equipment to South Korea for the purpose of increasing its military capacity allegedly to contain the DPRK, Seoul-based Yonhap News reported.
 He disclosed that the South Korean authorities are known to have asked for an aegis anti-aircraft defense system to be installed on three destroyers of new type and its related facilities and they would be delivered to South Korea in a few years to come.

Large-scale joint military exercises start
articles.content:
Large-scale joint military exercises start
     Pyongyang, March 22 (KCNA) -- The U.S. imperialists and the South Korean military authorities yesterday started the large-scale joint military exercises, a combination of "Reception, Staging, Onward movement and Integration Exercise" (RSOI) and "foal eagle" drills, targeted against the north, according to Seoul-based Radio No. 1.
 The exercises include rapid movement and deployment and joint field maneuvers of the U.S. reinforcements from outside under the simulated conditions of "emergency" on the Korean Peninsula. The exercises are participated in by more than 43,000 U.S. imperialist aggressor troops based in South Korea, the U.S. mainland, Japan, Guam and other areas and over 500,000 South Korean army soldiers under the South Korea-U.S. "combined forces command."    
 The U.S. imperialists, who declared this year as a "year of war" and designated the DPRK as a target of nuclear attacks, clamouring for "preemptive strikes," have launched the largest-scale joint military exercises, thus placing the Korean Peninsula under a touch-and-go-situation.

Kim Yong Nam receives credentials from new Mexican ambassador
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam receives credentials from new Mexican ambassador
     Pyongyang, March 22 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, President of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, received credentials from new Mexican ambassador  to the DPRK Rogelio Granguillhome Morfin at the Mansudae Assembly Hall today.
 Vice-minister of foreign affairs Kung Sok Ung was on hand.    
 Kim Yong Nam conversed with the ambassador after receiving the credentials.
